website_summaries.verdict: The Parrot Minikit Neo combines the great call quality that we've come to expect from Parrot devices with advanced technologies that make it safer to use and easier to live with.
pros: The Parrot Minikit Neo supports Bluetooth hands-free calling, address book sync, and audio streaming
Magic Words voice command allows for the initiation of calls without touching the unit
NFC takes all of the guesswork out of pairing
The Neo App Suite boosts convenience and customization
cons: Audio from the space-saving NXT speaker is good, but not great

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product and did not use it often. The sunshade was too think for the Parrot to be mounted. When I did use it I found myself needing charge the unit more often than not. It worked fine and I would have happier if I could attach it to the sunshade, so keep the thickness YOUR shade in mind when purchasing. I would recommend the parrot devices that can be installed in the vehicle. Much more hassle free. I passed this item to a friend. This parrot was not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny D

customer_reviews.title: Excellent voice, audio quality
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and use. I've had about a 50% success rate whenever I enter my car and having it automatically connect with my iPhone. Luckily, when it doesn't auto connect, you just press the green button to trigger the connection. Voice quality is excellent. Easy to adjust volume button. Battery life should last one to two weeks, less if you use phone more often, of course. I use mine in a convertible and while it's difficult to hear/talk to with the top down, it's easy to unclip and hold it closer. In fact, its portability is one of its best features as sometimes I'll even bring it into the house and use it there too.
customer_reviews.author: CydeOut

customer_reviews.title: Good option for hands free talking.
customer_reviews.text: I drive a 2009 Prius, and it did not come with hands free Bluetooth connectivity to my phone. And since we have moved to Maryland where it is ILLEGAL to drive while holding a phone up to your ear, the Parrot Minikit Neo gives you hands free connectivity, without something sticking in your ear. The sound quality is EXCELLENT, both in receiving calls and making calls. And it pairs to your phone easily. What's not to love?
customer_reviews.author: S. J. K. Haley

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an IOGear BT speakerphone because it did not support A2DP so it couldn't give me voice prompts for Google Maps. The Parrot does. I wish the speaker were a bit better in terms of sound quality at the volume level I need it to be but it's still understandable (if a little fuzzy). The only other caution I have for prospective buyers is to beware of the thickness of sun shade that this will clamp on to. On my 07 Altima, I can't slide this all the way on even though the clip is opened as wide as it will go.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Kang

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: This has been mostly good. The interface of the Bluetooth is fairly user-friendly but can be somewhat confusing with the menu options. The charging has been a bit of an issue because it will cut off med phone call but it chooses even though it's not dead. Has been mostly a great guy and functions perfectly 90% of the time.
customer_reviews.author: GlossBoss

customer_reviews.title: Nice little Gizmo
customer_reviews.text: As promised, this little guy has made my commute a more pleasant one. As advertised, pairing was quick. Calls are clear. Voice command is a plus for me. Still I would advise anyone to pay attention to the road and not get caught up in a a bad situation/accident. Highly recommend this product. By the way this little product does not stream music to you car stereo. I just wanted to mentioned it just in case you were wondering. Enjoy your purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sniteper_23

customer_reviews.title: I've had this Bluetooth device for a little over a ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this Bluetooth device for a little over a year. The first one I bought stopped working so the company replaced it free of charge. The second one I currently use worked for a bit but has now stopped working. The unit doesn't "wake-up" when I get in the car even though it is fully charged. When I plug it in it makes some weird sounds and sometimes work and sometimes doesn't. I sent a question to the company but no response. This costs way too much to work for under a year
customer_reviews.author: Jody Green

customer_reviews.title: It's super-pretty, but unfortunately, my unit stopped working ...
customer_reviews.text: It's super-pretty, but unfortunately, my unit stopped working within a week. Additionally, there is no mute mode, which requires you to fiddle with your handheld (read: DANGEROUS) while on a conference call. Needless to say, I've returned my unit.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Parrot MIMIKIT ROCKS!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just sold my car that had bluetooth built in and was stressing a lot about no longer having a 'Hands Free' solution. The Parrot works!! It pairs faster than my car did, the sound quality is just as good and the origial pair to my phone was very easy. I am VERY happy with this devise and bought a second one for my Mom.
customer_reviews.author: cindy olson

customer_reviews.title: Had one before just like this (from another business on amazon )and when it ...
customer_reviews.text: Had one before just like this (from another business on amazon )and when it was just a week over 1 year old it quit working. this time I bought the extra warrenty because I love this product and need it in my car.
customer_reviews.author: Don C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: I went from a bluetooth enabled car to an older car and wanted something hands-free. I read about this product on CNET, and I'm glad I ordered it. The connection with my iPhone 5 was seamless, including the downloading of the phonebook. The sound quality isn't as good as the Sync in my Focus, but since that lease is up, I'm perfectly happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: M Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hands free
customer_reviews.text: Excellent hands free, I have to travel long distances to work and easy to keep in touch with home. Battery life good, and easy to charge with car charger. Works very well. Nice voice too.
customer_reviews.author: LuciaO

customer_reviews.title: horrible. calls people out of the blue
customer_reviews.text: Threw it away. horrible. calls people out of the blue. I've owned a few different ones the Motorola Roadster is the best
customer_reviews.author: T. Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Great unit, but only for VERY THIN visors
customer_reviews.text: The unit itself is fantastic, sounds great, connects perfectly, really nothing to complain about at all, very well made etc. The downside, and it really is a make or break, the clasp can only open enough to accommodate a very thin visor. it fits on my wife's Honda Jazz (Fit) only just, it's at its max. It does not fit on my 1999 Mercedes SL, no way in the world, you would be snapping it in half. Bottom line, great for thin visors, useless for medium to thick ones.
customer_reviews.author: S D P

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: Awful this was 1st one and broke in a week , replacement lasted a month
customer_reviews.author: joseph mccoppin

customer_reviews.title: Did not work well for us and we returned it
customer_reviews.text: It's sleek and Parrot has a great reputation. However, it did not function well with my iPhone. Too much reverb for the listener. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: I. Band

customer_reviews.title: This device is designed to clip on the sun visor ...
customer_reviews.text: This device is designed to clip on the sun visor and didn't open wide enough to clip on my visor. The device worked ok but was unhappy with the mounting of it.
customer_reviews.author: Fireguy609

customer_reviews.title: Works/ or does it?
customer_reviews.text: Work great at first. Easy to set up. Connected automatically when I entered vehicle, calls where clear. After a week it started acting up, sometomes it would connect , sometimes not. Sometimes it make a call, someimes not. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Roessler

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good hands free kit. It has decent battery life and is simple to use once you take some time to understand its features and functions.
customer_reviews.author: L. Macdonald

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my wife safe!
customer_reviews.text: Really works as advertised. Some reviewers criticize the fit in a Roadrunner, but we have no problems. If you want to use voice recognition all the time be prepared to charge the batteries often.
customer_reviews.author: Mama wolf

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Crap
customer_reviews.text: I plan to return this item if at all possible for a full refund. I am unsure if the device is deffective or what, as it works inconsistently and certainly not always as described. User directions are poor at best and do not include all of the apparent functions. I do not recommend purchase of this item.
customer_reviews.author: tom lambert

customer_reviews.title: Loved the 2 phone option
customer_reviews.text: It lasted 8 months, then just died... other than that, it worked well when it was working. Loved the 2 phone option, both of my phones were paired.
customer_reviews.author: RBR

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the MINIKIT in 10/2013. The speaker is now shot making it unusable. The voice recognition system would pick up sounds from the radio and interpret them as someone in my contact list and dial them. Funny at first but annoying as it occurred again and again. I hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Not so good
customer_reviews.text: Good point: Senses when you enter the car through vibration Bad points: Can't recognise the word "Accept", so most calls are not answered Keeps asking "Who do you want to call?" whenever the car radio is on Short battery life
customer_reviews.author: John S

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to do very well.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly for hands free use of the phone while driving.
customer_reviews.author: Lawls

customer_reviews.title: Parrot Minikit review
customer_reviews.text: Pros: The device connects very fast. The battery life is quite good. Cons" Speaker quality could be better. Custom voice tags works only when the background noise is low.
customer_reviews.author: Alon

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable and poor support from manufacturer.
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty disappointed with this product. I attempted to purchase the best available and was not concerned about the price. The user manual is cryptic and the support is unavailable by phone and slow by email. I plan to return this device and will consider another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Bradshaw

customer_reviews.title: Yuk
customer_reviews.text: Unit shipped is not the one I chose . Seems to be a older model . Not impressed at all does not function as described. Would like to try the correct one if available. Feel betrayed
customer_reviews.author: KLKFAB

customer_reviews.title: Worked mostly okay for the first 6 months then became ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked mostly okay for the first 6 months then became unreliable. Several important programming functions ceased to work and as a result its value as a hands-free device was mostly lost.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Parrot! It's battery life is great, it is easy to make calls and the clairity if wonderful! Everyone should have a Parrot!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Lanter

customer_reviews.title: Great product! It works better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Great product! It works better than expected. Calls are clear, no echo on either end. When the time comes I'll buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: M. Persico

customer_reviews.title: Very handy to operate. It requires almost a full ...
customer_reviews.text: Very handy to operate. It requires almost a full charge to sync with the mobile phone, though.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Monterroso

customer_reviews.title: Needs a redesign.
customer_reviews.text: Good size. Portable but terrible sound. Can't hear contact due to excessive vibration.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: hands free with ease
customer_reviews.text: this unit works great, I don't even have to turn it off because it does so automatically. great sound and easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Gary M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Don't
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for 6 weeks. Now you can't call out either by voice or touch.
customer_reviews.author: BallMic

customer_reviews.title: Batery short life makes product almost useless
customer_reviews.text: The product is fairly good, but both products I bought became almost useless after a couple of weeks when the batery died for good making it necessary to use them always plagged in. Tried to charge the batery several times but they did not last more than 10 min each. I'm really dissappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Agus y Juampi Wyler

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative
customer_reviews.text: This is much better than wearing the ear piece.Battery life is good,calls are announced,sound is clear and charg up is fast
customer_reviews.author: M. BIANCHI

customer_reviews.title: Its decent for the money
customer_reviews.text: The unit is the right size and fits on my visor very well, the only thing that I have really notice is when making a call the windows have to b up due to outside noise and there is an echo on the receiving end.
customer_reviews.author: bigdawg59197

customer_reviews.title: NOT very clear/loud while driving a Nissan Titan
customer_reviews.text: My truck is NOT a diesel, however, it's still too loud for this product. I would NOT invest in this if you own a truck. It would have worked pretty good in my car that I sold last a few months ago.
customer_reviews.author: B. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to configure, easy to learning, easy to use and can use with many cell phone model. Excellent purchase.
customer_reviews.author: parabellum79

customer_reviews.title: Once the battery drops under 70% it starts sounding pretty bad, but keep it fully charged and it ...
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says it will. Once the battery drops under 70% it starts sounding pretty bad, but keep it fully charged and it does fine.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Stehler

customer_reviews.title: So i need to charge it more often than i would like.
customer_reviews.text: Extremly simple use! The only limitation is that the charge of the battery doesn't work more than a day. So i need to charge it more often than i would like.
customer_reviews.author: Esteban Amestica

customer_reviews.title: blue tooth alternative
customer_reviews.text: Works really well speaker is loud enough to hear picks up voice commands good great alternative if you don't have blue tooth capability through you radio would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: ralph heersema

customer_reviews.title: hard to understand people.
customer_reviews.text: its hard to understand people sometimes and the ringer on out calls it to quiet. it wouldn't charge the second time and i had to clear the memory so it would charge
customer_reviews.author: Valerie L. Reffert

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted a inexpensive hands free Bluetooth. This fits the bill. Easy to use nothing fancy. If you have a thick visor this won't work.
customer_reviews.author: Diane M. Omeara

customer_reviews.title: the Bluetooth connection with my cellular doesn't connect automatically as ...
customer_reviews.text: the Bluetooth connection with my cellular doesn't connect automatically as I am entering the car.....
customer_reviews.author: yoyo

customer_reviews.title: Parrot review
customer_reviews.text: The Parrot works just ok hard to get it to make calls with voice command and battery does not last as long as stated
customer_reviews.author: JAY CORTES

customer_reviews.title: not user friendly
customer_reviews.text: you have to be a computer whiz to program this item. I do not consider it user friendly in the least.
customer_reviews.author: David L McDaniel

customer_reviews.title: Best car hands-free
customer_reviews.text: Best car hands-free really !!!! Voice control and long life battery + loud speakerphone. Good work with Android (Samsung S4)
customer_reviews.author: Evgeny

customer_reviews.title: Great hands free device
customer_reviews.text: I did print the owners manual from the on line site but the fast set-up instructions were ok. Once set up it works great.
customer_reviews.author: John McKeone

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. An inexpensive way to go "hands Free."
customer_reviews.author: Gilbert R Payne

customer_reviews.title: Parrot MINIKIT NEO
customer_reviews.text: Very good, successful update for the Chinese, the recognition rate is very high, making driving safer. Cheap, support language versions of many
customer_reviews.author: Cecachen Chen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This device exceeded my expectations. I'm amazed at how well it works. Buy it if you need a hands free device
customer_reviews.author: Marquita T. Wiley

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift for my GF and she seems to like it very much. On the other end, it sounds perfect and much better than the standard iPhone speakerphone.
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't get it to work
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I did something wrong, but I followed the directions in the manual and I wasn't able to get it to execute my voice commands. Didn't like the fact that, if you set it to listen for your command, rather than press a button before speaking, the battery would discharge must faster. I gave up and returned the product.
customer_reviews.author: PeteTheGolfer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: All of the other positive reviews are true. Easy to set up and use. Voice recognition is very good. Very satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Marcel

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy Product
customer_reviews.text: Clear Sound Sturdy Construction Easy to use Setup was a no brainer Automated Calling with ease Small compact size and shape
customer_reviews.author: Erin S. Capecchi

customer_reviews.title: Blue Tooth
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specific blue tooth after reading about it in popular science magazine, what a mistake at first it worked pretty good about a week or two, then the problems started dropping calls, not connecting automatic, almost every i get in to my truck it doesn't connect i have to fiddle with it sometimes i have to reboot it and reboot my cell phone also.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Rouzaud

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money! Stick with a Bluetooth earpiece. Not very responsive, has no idea where my car is parked, made cheap, and very difficult to hear on a call. Piece of crap don't waste your money. I also tried the Motorola roadster 2 that one is made better, but motospeak is horrible and callers had a hard time hearing me. Like I mentioned stick with an earpiece.
customer_reviews.author: TonyD

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the worst item I have purchased from your site. I have never said that before. It just did not meet my expectations in any way!!
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Parrot PF-410008 Review
customer_reviews.text: This product is doing what I need. The only issue is leaving the outgoing call voice activation on. It is in a noisy diesel truck and it was picking up the noise as a command to dial. Just turned that option off and use the green button to be able to give voice commands for dialing. Even in this noisy truck the called party can hear me very clearly and the speaker is loud enough for mwe to hear as well. I had tried others and they just wouldn't work in this truck so overall the Parrot is a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Nelles

customer_reviews.title: Great...as long as you don't need to hear the person you're talking to
customer_reviews.text: This one comes close. Good design, Good batter life, Good microphone. Good Price. Why only two stars? The speaker is horrendous. I could barely understand people I was talking to. It had a tinny rattle (I know, but it's hard to describe) and zero bass. It made hearing others, particularly guys with deep voices nearly impossible. Suggest you look elsewhere for a good in car speakerphone. This one just doesn't cut it.
customer_reviews.author: Five ATMs

customer_reviews.title: You will get your money's worth with this one.
customer_reviews.text: This thing works better than expected, fantastic! Parrot makes the best mobile blue tooth devices out there and this one is perfect, I cant see needing anything else, the volume is plenty loud and just does everything like it should. You will get your money's worth with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: it's ok
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased that item based on the reputation of that company and also the customer reviews but at the sametime didn't want to spend much. The sound quality is good only when driving at low speeds, like in town, but on the highway it's hardly clear. Other than that, it's simple to set up and pair with my iPhone plus easy to update its software. That's why I only gave it 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: amkmeco90

customer_reviews.title: I had faith in the brand
customer_reviews.text: I used it for 3 weeks on a normal basis consuming power and charging it without any problem, everything was fine, suddenly it just stopped. There's no way I can power up the device, apparently there's full charge and it should work but it isn't. I had the model before this one for years of use and I just wanted to upgrade. I kind of lost faith in the brand now.
customer_reviews.author: frankreds

customer_reviews.title: Unimpressive performance at best
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in an effort drive safer. I truly believe it has made talking while driving more dangerous than using the phone itself. The unit has poor voice recognition and a mind of its own. It pairs and connects when and if it feels like it, it understands about 1/10 of the names said and makes up its own contacts. It disconnects at will and drops calls regularly. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: kimberly L. warne

customer_reviews.title: and audio quality in mine is better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected, and audio quality in mine is better than I expected. I'm a bit frustrated with the instruction manual though. Small print & old eyes don't go well together, and some of the functions of the device don't match the explanations in the booklet. As with many of today's gadgets, one must experiment and learn the hard way. A longer battery life would be appreciated. I think it deserves at least 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Orv Graham

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little blue tooth for traveling in rental cars or just to use in any car without built in Bluetooth. I got one and loaned it to my brother to try and he was so impressed with it that I bought a second one for him. Easy to sync to your phone and use
customer_reviews.author: DOREEN ROYER

customer_reviews.title: EASY!
customer_reviews.text: I was afraid I wouldn't be able to get it all set up but once it is charged - it does everything pretty much on its own. I really like it because of the fact it is not in my ear. Glad I chose this one!
customer_reviews.author: Vicki

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my daughter for Christmas. Now, when she calls, I know she is hands-free and able to drive more safely and I can hear her, minus all the background noise, so I don't have to ask her to keep repeating herself.
customer_reviews.author: E. L. Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent voice recognition, noise cancellation, battery life between recharging. It also looks good. I have two, the Neo and the Minikit +. Both work very well. I wish the microphone had better quality sound, but it's nitpicking on my part.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this product.
customer_reviews.text: Battery stays charged for a very short time. "Magic Word" setting leads to frequent and random "Who would you like to call" outburst off of conversation in the car or something of the radio. People on the other end have told me that the voice quality is poor. Speaker often not loud enough to be heard over freeway noise.
customer_reviews.author: Sidney Wolinsky

customer_reviews.title: Works part time.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice unit, when it works. Returned the first one and the second did the same thing. When I get in the car only sometimes it would turn on. I paid for it to turn on every time not when it wants. Other then that a great unit.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Good, but poor speaker.
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a number of these types of units. This one seems very good in terms of the people I'm calling being able to hear me well. However, I really don't care for the speaker...very tinny and difficult to understand what people are saying. Also, the battery life, even using its "deep sleep" feature, is much less than I would have hoped.
customer_reviews.author: PhillyGuy54

customer_reviews.title: Useful gadget
customer_reviews.text: It's a useful gadget. It allow you to answer and make phone calls without take out the sight while you driving and drastically reducing the lost of attention and concentration when you go to use your cellphone.
customer_reviews.author: Reuters70

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: very pleased with this. So much so I bought a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Bluetooth hands-free car kit
customer_reviews.text: Great Bluetooth hands-free car kit to pair with your cell phone. Parrot has made this on the best on the market. This one even made Poplar Mechanics for it's 'wow factor'
customer_reviews.author: J Carl

customer_reviews.title: complicated
customer_reviews.text: complicated. What more need I say. It is small and the switches are even smaller....just too difficult for older fingers.
customer_reviews.author: S. D. Hill

customer_reviews.title: PF41008
customer_reviews.text: Got several for a wedding gift. Most users have older cars without the built-in features. Have to remember to push button to wake it up when you get in car
customer_reviews.author: Jack E. Crain

customer_reviews.title: Not that great
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality was not very good in the car or when listening to a call from the Parrot. Also the materials look and feel cheap. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Neat thing!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Just say "minikit" and it'll call whomever you'd like
customer_reviews.author: Mary Gagliardi

customer_reviews.title: best hands free device i have had
customer_reviews.text: no more fumbling with the phone to answer while driving. I like it, it tells me who's calling. (how does it know?)
customer_reviews.author: pegleg

customer_reviews.title: Very Useful!
customer_reviews.text: It sounds great on both ends of calls. Mine is a bit strange though. When it tells you a percentage of how charged it is, it turns off if it gets to 70%. I thought it was broken, until I figured this out. Other than that, the Parrot Minikit is very nice!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J. Richart

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bad, bad, bad, the worst waste of money of my entire life
customer_reviews.author: Andres

customer_reviews.title: Precise and simple
customer_reviews.text: I use it in Mexico so it has to work in Spanish, I downloaded the required software from their website and it runs great, no mismatches or unwanted calls, it is simple to use and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Gerson

customer_reviews.title: ... have purchased two of this model and I'm leally disappointed because both have same bad operation
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased two of this model and I'm leally disappointed because both have same bad operation. Even with the latest update freeze the operation and you need to speak without the parrot too many times. ..
customer_reviews.author: ACH Contratistas RNC 101542535

customer_reviews.title: Luv it!!!  It is a must for hands free!!  very clear reception
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Ordered 2 more of these for my daughters. Very clear reception. Operates with a touch of a finger.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excelent Gadget
customer_reviews.text: works great, is beautiful and fool proof. increases driving safety considerably, easily updated to any language. oncee you have it you dont want anything else.
customer_reviews.author: ROD

customer_reviews.title: Very good hands free bluetooth device.
customer_reviews.text: very good product works as described. doesn't hold a charge as long as the manufacturer says but no problem charging daily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the way it links to Siri
customer_reviews.text: great, on time works well for me, looking for a better way to keep it charged in the car but good
customer_reviews.author: Groundunitone

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing Very poor battery life and quality of reception
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing Very poor battery life and quality of reception poor
customer_reviews.author: LLS

customer_reviews.title: Parrot hands free Bluetooth car kit
customer_reviews.text: We love this item! It is very easy to set up & use. Even my wife finds it easy to use. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: retired toe

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad
customer_reviews.text: Still haven't quite got to grips with it and clearly doesn't like my English accent for the magic words, so is a bit frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Newman

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not as user friendly as I would have liked for my truck driver husband.
customer_reviews.author: Teina

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Battery died after 1 month. Now I can't use it withoutttt being continuously connected to charger.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Maybe better to buy new
customer_reviews.text: Mediocre quality. I bought this second hand. Maybe better to buy new?!
customer_reviews.author: bastiaensen

customer_reviews.title: Piece of s***
customer_reviews.text: Connected phone and used it twice. Went to charge it today, now the device won't even turn on nor will it reset. Technical service is non-existent. Less than two months after I received it and of course Amazon says the last day to return it was yesterday. Nice.
customer_reviews.author: jdc

customer_reviews.title: not great sound
customer_reviews.text: the gadget kind of works but some times it looses contact with the phone and its a hassel to pair again and the quality of the sound is not great
customer_reviews.author: Mauricio Romandia Creel

customer_reviews.title: Compact, neat design and works great
customer_reviews.text: The Parrot Minikit Nano was easy to set up and works as advertised. Great clarity. I would recommend for vehicle use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: OK For The Money
customer_reviews.text: If you drive an older vehicle that doesn't have an AUX input for Bluetooth devices then this is not a bad device for the money. I do find that background noise can cause it to attempt a call, as well as it doesn't always understand my voice commands for calling or GPS. Overall it is a good device and I would recommend it for wireless Bluetooth users as an alternative to an earpiece.
customer_reviews.author: Paul
